Information
Simple
Medium
Hard
Standing with feet shoulder-width apart, the hips are lowered by bending the knees, then returning to a standing position, targeting the lower body muscles.
Starting in a prone position, the body is pushed up and lowered by bending and straightening the arms, engaging the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
Similar to regular push-ups, but with the hands close together under the chest, forming a diamond shape, emphasizing triceps engagement.
Assuming a position similar to a push-up but with the forearms on the ground, this exercise engages the core muscles, promoting stability and strength.
Combining a squat, push up, and jump, this full body exercise involves starting in a standing position, dropping to a plank, performing a push up, and jumping back up.
Stepping forward with one leg, bending both knees to lower the body, and then returning to the starting position, targeting the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
Lying straight on a bench, a barbell is lowered to the chest and then pushed back up, targeting the chest muscles, shoulders, and especially triceps.
Sitting still on a machine, the legs are extended from a bent position repeatedly, targeting the quadriceps muscles on the front of the thighs.
Sitting at a pulldown machine, a bar is grabbed with both hands and pulled down to the upper chest, engaging the "latissimus dorsi" muscles of the back.
Standing or seated (better to stand), a barbell is lifted from shoulder level to an overhead position, targeting the shoulder muscles and triceps.
Standing at a cable machine, a bar is pushed down against resistance, again with both hands, targeting the triceps muscles on the back of the upper arms.
Standing with dumbbells, the arms are curled up with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), targeting the biceps muscles (very important to be still).
Standing with either both legs or a single on the edge of a step or platform, the heels are lifted to raise the body up, targeting the calf muscles.
Lying on an inclined bench, a barbell is lowered to the upper chest and then pressed back up, targeting the upper chest, shoulders, and triceps.
Standing with one foot elevated behind, lower the body by bending the front knee, targeting the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings. Alternate legs a few times
Bent over at a 45 degree angle with a barbell, pull it towards the torso while keeping the back straight, targeting the upper back muscles, lats, and biceps.
An exercise invented by Arnold. Standing or seated, dumbbells are pressed overhead while rotating the palms, targeting the shoulders, triceps, and upper back.
Lying on a bench, an EZ bar is lowered to the forehead and then extended upward, targeting the triceps muscles. Can be done with dumbbells.
Standing with a barbell, curl it upward towards the shoulders in a single, slow motion, while keeping the elbows stationary, targeting the biceps muscles.
Standing with a barbell on the floor, lift it by extending the hips and knees while keeping the back straight, targeting the posterior chain muscles.

This simple plan is primarily for people who want to exercise casually and/or do not have enough time to commit to exercising. Here, you will find simple exercises that do not require gym equipment and can be done from the comfort of your home.

The medium plan is not much harder than the simple one, but it is more time-consuming. It is perfect for users who have more time on their hands but do not want the hardest exercises. Note: Some gym equipment is required.

The hardest exercises are for the strongest! In this plan, there are a lot of exercises, and the difficulty greatly increases from the medium plan. This plan requires the most attention and time but also promises the best results. Note: Gym equipment is required.

Our plans are reliable, effective, and most importantly, customizable for each and every one of our users. We offer three levels of difficulty: easy, for people who do not have enough time to fully commit themselves; medium, for more experienced users; and hard, for the best results. You will not regret using our plans, which focus on three main goals: maintaining bodyweight, building muscle, and losing weight. With all these options, we guarantee that all users will find something to suit them. Most importantly, everything is completely free. Forever.
